Reviews.Title: “Nice , convenient, clean”
Reviews.Author: Maristel13
Reviews.Content: It had all that matter! Very clean, kind staff, good location... A disadvantage was that the noise from the road was too loud..

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: CathouYannou
Reviews.Content: The good things were the location near Termini, the little restaurant nearby and the bath sheets. We had a room with a window on the street and the first night it was very noisy because of the bar across the street. The walls are very thin. The room smelled funny but was cleaned every day. The bathroom's lightbulb went out at some point but it was changed when we got back that night. Rome is an expensive city and for that kind of price I don't think it gets a lot better than that.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for Rome”
Reviews.Author: CarmemGoncalves
Reviews.Content: Rome is an expensive city, so the price we payed for this hotel was good. The breakfast was delicious, the room was great too. The bathroom was a little small, but at least was clean.Its next to Termini station, about 3 blocks, so you dont need a taxi to go there, you can go walking, even with your luggage :)

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: NikhilNarayan
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay. Little far from the mainstream Rome but still not too bad. It is near both Rome's train station and a Metro station (Castro Pretorio). Both these places are walking distance. So travelers can easily purchase metro cards and given Rome is a small city, it does not take much time to travel around. In fact the best thing is the fact that there are number of restaurants and bars nearby which are relatively cheap because they are not in mainstream Rome. Rooms are kept clean. A buffet breakfast is also available which is pretty decent. I would say good value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal and good value”
Reviews.Author: sust
Reviews.Content: My second stay here. I stayed one night en route to Casperia and it suited my needs perfectly. 10 mins away from where I was dropped off from the airport and less than 5 mins from the metro for my onward journey. Clean rooms and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Alison6
Reviews.Content: Rome is very expensive and this is a reaonably priced hotel, with clean rooms which were serviced daily, fairly pleasant staff with good english skills and located close to the termini train station. There is also a cheap bar across the road which is very lively (it's part of a hostel but good atmosphere) and a nice restaurant just two doors down. If you had a room at the front I expect it would be noisy but we were at the back and it was fine. However, it is not really that great a location for the sites of Rome so you need to be prepared for a lot of walking or use the Metro/buses, which are close by. Our room was clean but that's about the only positive. The air con was very ineffective, tiny TV on top of the tall wardrobe, small shower, and dark outdated room. My bed was comfortable but my friends matress was old lumpy and springy. Luckily we were in a triple room so she could swap the matress! I think if you just want a clean base without many other expectations for your accomodation then it's ok, but I would sincerely hope that something a little fresher and more modern for the same price could be found. There was no fridge, tea/coffee facilites, safe or other amenities in the room! Some of the reviews said the area was unsafe but we found it perfectly fine, as two females, and never felt any problems regarding security. Our room price didn't include breakfast so I can't comment on the food but the other negative was that the free Wifi was only intermittantly available and you had to go to the breakfast room to be (90%) sure it would connect!

Reviews.Title: “Laptop and Ipad was stolen from room.”
Reviews.Author: Nicole F
Reviews.Content: My MacBook Pro Laptop and my parents Ipad was stolen out of the room. The hotel said they would reimburse us for the stolen items. We are still waiting for the check and will let everyone know if we get it or not.

Reviews.Title: “A lot better than the reviews made it sound!”
Reviews.Author: sazmeister88
Reviews.Content: No problems at all! The reviews on here made it sound like a dingy unsafe little room with a tiny bathroom but both were spacious enough, the room was clean and there was very little noise from outside - a pleasant surprise after reading the reviews! The mattress seemed a bit old but still slept comfortably. Reception were happy to hold our luggage until our flight and hold our (heavy!) room key whilst we were out. Free maps of Rome at reception too, bigger than the one we'd brought with us, and great location 5 minutes from the Termini! Only bad points, no safe or fridge in the room, but it didn't inconvenience us. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Accommodation in Rome”
Reviews.Author: African_Lion26
Reviews.Content: You will find the Hotel Continentale not too far away from Roma Termini Station (which is the main railway station). Nearby there is a bus and metro station and so you will reach all parts of Rome’s city centre in an appropriate time. Well, the building that contains the hotel cannot be called attractive and the hotel does not offer a beautiful sight as well. Rooms are rather small, but they are clean and the furniture is in a relatively good condition. The whole hotel is absolutely o.k. and sufficient if you do not look for too much luxury, but for an affordable accommodation. The staff (most of them English speaking) is very friendly and helpful. They make you enjoy your stay. Breakfast can be called surprisingly good compared to other hotels in Italy in general and in Rome in particular. The price-quality ratio is really excellent. So if you come to Rome and look for a practical accommodation without lots of luxury, but at a reasonable price the Hotel Continentale is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “poor quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: 19anthony55
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in this hotel, with a friend, paying US$145/night. Positive things: staff is friendly, curteous and speaks acceptable English; breakfast is acceptable in quality, diversity and amount Negative things: the room is tiny, the bed is very uncomfortable, the bathroom and especially the shower is so tiny that it's almost impossible to use; everything in the room is old and outdated; the TV is a 12" analog TV.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location near Termini.”
Reviews.Author: kixguy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Continentale is a budget-friendly hotel. Offers basic accommodation in a great location. A short walk from Termini. The hotel is in building that houses a few more similar hotels. Being a solo traveller, I got a single room but with a large double bed. My room was in the corner, away from the noise. The window opened in a backyard of buildings so didn't have a great view, but the quietness was good. The staff at the front are extremely friendly and helpful. Free wi-fi is available in the lobby and the breakfast room. Talking of breakfast, Continentale perhaps has the best buffet breakfast that I've seen in budget hotels in Italy. Lots of juice, croissants, donuts, cheese and yogurt etc.!! Overall, a nice, friendly, hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “good place to sleep in overpriced Rome”
Reviews.Author: igorek
Reviews.Content: I spend a lot of time reading all reviews to find an acceptable cheap hotel near the train station. Rome is VERY expensive: if you want "ritz-like" service you need to pay for it. Continentale hotel is a cheap place by Rome standards, but it is NOT a hostel, it provides all basic accommodations with overall good service. I paid $480 for 4 nights for double room thru orbitz.com with coupons/discounts. The hotel is less than 10 min. walk from Termini and 3 min from another metro station. There are couple more hotels in the same building. The hotel is run by an Italian family (unlike Indians next door), very polite and friendly. The breakfast was included in the room price and was standard european style, though the choices decreased after 9am. The room is small, has a big closet and the desk. The small TV (~12" ?) is mounted by the ceiling. Unless you are planning to use this hotel only to sleep at night or occasional day rests, don't consider it and pay more than $400/night for a full service hotel. It's a safe neighborhood and a local "magistratura" is the next building. Now negatives: 1) only one power outlet in the room, 2) minuscule shower - "grasso americano" may not fit at all :-) but there is extra space for bidet, 3) the "double" bed is made from two twins - may separate at night 4) no personal safe in the room, though the reception desk stored safely our documents

Reviews.Title: “Not at all good rooms”
Reviews.Author: VinitS
Reviews.Content: The hotel didn't have good room. Bathroom was cramped and u cud barely stand and take bath in the shower area. The bed was not at all comfortable and the view from bedroom was poor. Overall it is not an expensive hotel, but not at all comfortable to spend time. Even though you might just use it to sleep, but bathroom was a big pain in the morning when you want a comfortable time getting ready for the day. My back was aching in the morning due to poor bed quality and heating was not turned on and AC was not working. Breakfast was sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay.....”
Reviews.Author: Mags40roma
Reviews.Content: Never could understand why people want to spend so much $$$$$$$ for a place to sleep. We are up by 0700 and home by 2200, and we would crash. The hotel was a great place to stay, the staff was great and always ready to help. The B-fast was fine, we had enough to eat and it was something to fill the gut till later. I am one to say that the room is there for three reasons, bathroom, bed and sleep..... not in that order. The hotel was really easy to find from transit, and there is a place right acoss the street which was awesome, "TAVERNA PRETORIANA" eat there well worth it....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rcsmit
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, without any problem. Very, very friendly staff which speaks well English. (esp. the young lady with blond hair) It's a little bit outside the center, but it's near Termini where all the (night)busses end. One little tip: ask a receipt for the payments because they thought we didn't pay neither for the rooms neither for the remote control. Breakfast (included) is however to be improved: how ever enough was the quality of the products not fantastic (very bad coffee, B-products) . But Termini and other foodoutlets are close to have a good breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pookinmeto
Reviews.Content: Have just returned, had a very plesant stay. Rooms very clean,breakfast plenty to eat. Excellent location. Staff very friendly, nothing too much trouble. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and clean”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideNeedmysleep
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good value and clean. We arrived from Australia at around 8am and went directly to the hotel. We had been told that we could leave the bags or if the room was ready, we could have it straightaway (this was arranged by email with the hotel prior to our trip). In fact, we only had to wait around 15 minutes and the room was ready and we were allowed to take our bags up and have a shower before going out to see the sights. It was quite hot in Rome the 3 days we were there but the aircon coped quite well. The street was a little noisy with normal traffic first thing in the morning but generally we slept well. There was some good places to eat in the streets around the hotel which didn't rip us off - good quality fresh pasta. We booked the room without breakfast as there were lovely coffee bars nearby. There was a couple of small mercatos close by so that we could buy fresh fruit and water. Internet cafes nearby in the next street so we check our footytips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: cruisinpaige
Reviews.Content: Booked on Romeby.com, about $139 US a night. In 2005 I stayed at the Hotel Continentale for a couple of days before a cruise out of Rome. Great Little Hotel!!! FACILITIES: It is clean, cheap, and the rooms are small but comfortable. We had a great little balcony with an adorable view. Breakfast was free, and the staff was great! On the last day, we checked out but were allowed to leave our bags in the (tiny) lobby for most of the day until we came back for our bags and went to the train to our ship. There was no tub in our room but the hot strong shower and awesome towels totally made up for that! Also you have to get your bags up one flight of stairs but they are wide and marble so its no big deal and the staff will help you if you ask nicely. LOCATION: It's walking distance from the Termini train station (2-3 blocks?), so you can take the train from the airport (FCO) to the Termini Station and you are there in no time. All aorund the hotel are convenient little coffee and other shops. The Coliseum, Spanish Steps, are all within walking distance. it's VERY close the Diocetian's baths, a great little side stop. Everything else (Vatican, etc) are quickly reachable by the train. When I go back to Rome, I am staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive, worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Styl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was surprisingly good, the room is small, but has enough space for luggage, the rooms were clean and fresh every day and the customer service was always very helpful. The elevators were handy, which was very convenient. Breakfast was included in the price and was a lovely buffet, endless croissants, biscuits, bread, juice, coffee, milk and biscuits with nutella. The location was perfect 5 minute walk from Termini station which was very handy, the main train station where you can catch any train into Rome which was only 10 - 15 minutes. Overall a great place to say for the price and would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location but lousy value”
Reviews.Author: Raahi
Reviews.Content: Location, location - a few blocks from the Statione Terminale - where the Metro lines connect, inter city trains depart/arrive, you can even catch a train to the airport from here. The room - cheaply furnished. Frankly, the worst of the rooms we had in seven cities in Europe but it did have a window. If you can find something better for the same price in the neighbourhood, take it. Pleanty of places to eat nearby. A so-so Continental Breakfast is included. Take the hop-on hop-off bus once and then take the bus/metro everywhere. Do eat some pizza and gelato - even if you get sick of it after a while - you wont get anything like it in the States.

Reviews.Title: “There must be better value”
Reviews.Author: SCC2104
Reviews.Content: This is not all it's cracked up to be. Yes it's clean but that's all. With tiled floors and no double glazing it is noisey especially at the rear. You can even hear the coffee maker being used at breakfast time. In general it lacks facilities. No international satellite TV, no safe, no fridge and the only power point was more than 2m above the floor. If all else fails stay there but there has to be better value.

Reviews.Title: “A real treat - Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: martincobb
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 5 nights at the Hotel Continentale in Rome. This hotel is a real find and far better than the previous reviews will lead you to believe. For anyone wanting a mid-range hotel in the centre of Rome then choose the Continentale. You'll be lucky to find anywhere better value for money in the whole of Rome. Although only 5 minutes from the Termini station it is actually in a very good neighbourhood, very quiet and with lots of restaurants close by. Never once did we feel unsafe, even at night. It also makes it easy to get around Rome as you have the train, metro and buses just 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The rooms are spacious, clean and tidy, and the bathrooms are small but well kept and have complimentary toiletries that are replaced each day. I had a balcony that looked over onto the interior courtyard where I could sit and read and plan the next day’s activities. Breakfast was your standard buffet continental affair with a great coffee machine and a selection of croissants. The breakfast room also doubles as a bar and the hotel staff really will serve you 24/7, even opening the room just for you. By far the most important aspect of this hotel is the staff. They are welcoming and friendly and will do anything they can to make your stay as pleasant as possible. The girl on reception through the day is wonderfully helpful. I never got her name but you’ll know who I mean the instant you meet her. She will give you maps and directions, make reservations for museums (Borghese) and restaurants. She knows all the best places to eat at exceptionally good value for money. Almost ever night we had a different restaurant recommendation and they were all superb. For all round value for money you will not get anything better in this price range in the whole of Rome. Don’t let the 2 stars put you off as many 3 star hotels in Rome don’t offer this level of commitment and service. I look forward to returning again next year. Check out their website [--] as best prices are offered if you book with them direct or through [--]

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the room and bathroom were quite small, the beds were very comfortable, the water was hot and everything was spotless. The folks at the front desk were so kind and helpful, even calling to arrange a tour of Rome for us. The hotel is on a fairly quiet street. There is a great little ristorante across the street which caused some noise, but earplugs are a must anywhere in Rome! The hotel is a five minute walk to the termini station, very easy. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to disagree with the other reviewer. Myself and my boyfiend stayed here for 2 nights in October. I daresay it was very basic but I hadn't expected much more for the very reasonable price we paid to stay here. I wouldn't recommend staying here for more than 2 or 3 nights but since we spent very little time in the room it was perfect for us. It was clean- fresh towels everyday and the breakfast was actually pretty good! Croisssants, bread, cereal, orange juice, coffee, hot chocolate etc. We actually thought the bathroom was an ok size and didnt notice much noise from outside or any smells?! The hotel was about 3mins walk from the Termini where the Ryanair bus dropped us off- so v. handy in that sense too. Also lots of reasonable restaurants nearby offering discounts when you are staying here. All in all good value for money and all we needed in this fantastic city.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Continentale
HotelInfo.Address: via Palestro, 49, 00185 Rome, Italy
